net.proteusframework.core.mail

Class TransportAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.mail.TransportAgent

  • public class TransportAgent
extends java.lang.Object
    A TransportAgent manages a Transport. The purpose of the agent is to manage sending messages via a transport. The Transport.send(Message) static method may be preferred when sending a single message. To use this class you need to supply a protocol to be used such as "smtp" or "nntp". A provider for that protocol must be available. As of JavaMail 1.2 sun supplies a smtp transport. If you are using another transport you must specify the class name in the Properties that are passed to the constructor. Some possible properties to specify:
    • mail.limitrecipientdomains
      A comma separated list of domains to retrict recipient email addresses to. Useful in the qa/test environment.
    • mail. protocol .class
      The class name of the transport provider for this protocol.
    • mail. protocol .host
      Specifies the server to use..
    • mail. protocol .port
      The server port to use.
    • mail.smtp.sendpartial
      Set to true and the message will be sent to all valid addresses; otherwise, if there are any invalid addresses the message will not be sent. This Property is specific to Sun's smtp transport implementation.
    See the javadoc for the transport provider you are using for more information.

    This class is not thread safe. Access to this class should be synchronized where appropriate.

    Consider using MailProviderHandler in the future to send messages.

    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@proteus.co)
